thread.title: Sarah Robb O’Hagan: Fitness Is Her Business
thread.title_full: Sarah Robb O’Hagan: Fitness Is Her Business - WSJ

author: Alexandra Wolfe
title: Sarah Robb O’Hagan: Fitness Is Her Business
text:
In July, Sarah Robb O’Hagan was training for her fourth mud run event, a shorter version of the obstacle-course race Tough Mudder, when she fell and hurt her knee. It was an unwelcome setback for the president of Equinox Holdings, the company that owns the Equinox fitness clubs, Pure Yoga studios and cycling chain Soul Cycle. She had to get five stitches and couldn’t walk for two weeks. “Me being on crutches is the hardest thing in the world,” she jokes.
For someone who usually works out every day—either running around 5...
